      • getNodes

        public Nodes getNodes(java.lang.String controllerAddress,
             java.lang.String queryString)
        Retrieve a list of all the nodes connected to a given controller in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        controllerAddress - Optional parameter to retrieve the nodes connected to another controller in the cluster
        Returns:
        A list of Nodes Node 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/connectionmanager/nodes?controller=1.1.1.1

 Response body in XML:
  <list>
       <node>
           <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:52</id>
           <type>OF</type>
       </node>
       <node>
           <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:3e</id>
           <type>OF</type>
       </node>
   </list>

  Response body in JSON:
  {
       "node": [
           {
               "type": "OF",
               "id": "00:00:00:00:00:00:00:52"
           },
           {
               "type": "OF",
               "id": "00:00:00:00:00:00:00:3e"
           }
       ]
   }

      • connect

        public Node connect(java.lang.String nodeId,
           java.lang.String ipAddress,
           java.lang.String port)
        If a Network Configuration Service needs a Management Connection and if the Node Type is unknown, use this REST api to connect to the management session. 
        
 Example :

 Request :
 PUT http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/connectionmanager/node/mgmt1/address/1.1.1.1/port/6634

 Response :
 Node :
 xml :
 <node>
    <id>mgmt1</id>
    <type>STUB</type>
 </node>

 json:
 {"id": "mgmt1","type": "STUB"}
        Parameters:
        nodeId - User-Defined name of the node to connect with. This can be any alpha numeric value
        ipAddress - IP Address of the Node to connect with.
        port - Layer4 Port of the management session to connect with.
        Returns:
        Node If the connection is successful, HTTP 404 otherwise.

      • connect

        public Node connect(java.lang.String nodeType,
           java.lang.String nodeId,
           java.lang.String ipAddress,
           java.lang.String port)
        If a Network Configuration Service needs a Management Connection, and if the node Type is known, the user can choose to use this REST api to connect to the management session. 
        
 Example :

 Request :
 PUT http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/connectionmanager/node/STUB/mgmt1/address/1.1.1.1/port/6634

 Response : Node :
 xml :
 <node>
    <id>mgmt1</id>
    <type>STUB</type>
 </node>

 json:
 {"id": "mgmt1","type": "STUB"}
        Parameters:
        nodeType - Type of the Node the connection is made for.
        nodeId - User-Defined name of the node to connect with. This can be any alpha numeric value
        ipAddress - IP Address of the Node to connect with.
        port - Layer4 Port of the management session to connect with.
        Returns:
        Node If the connection is successful, HTTP 404 otherwise.

      • disconnect

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response disconnect(java.lang.String nodeType,
                                   java.lang.String nodeId)
        Disconnect an existing Connection. 
        
 Example :

 Request :
 DELETE http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/connectionmanager/node/STUB/mgmt1
        Parameters:
        nodeType - Type of the Node
        nodeId - Connection's NodeId.
